you
[Music]
hi and welcome you listening to the x-22
report my name is Dave and this is
episode 1283 a and today's date is May
18th 2017 and the thought of the episode
is central bankers deep state have set
up the economy to crash under Trump now
before I get started I just want to make
an announcement I placed an interview
with Stephen lemon on the x-22 reports
spotlight YouTube channel so if you go
over to YouTube and you type in X going
to report spotlight it will bring you
right to the video or you can come over
to the X 20 to report calm site scroll
down a little bit look over the
right-hand side you'll see the video
there and you can play right on the site
or you can go to News Sentinel calm same
thing scroll down a little bit look over
to your right hand side and you can play
the video right on the site let's get
into the economic collapse financial
news now as we can see a lot of
corporations their earnings they're
being broadcast out to the public and a
lot of companies their earnings are not
looking that great now these
corporations they've been downsizing
they've been laying off people they've
been shutting manufacturing plants
they've been doing stock buyback but
doing everything they possibly can to
make their company look profitable and
we're starting to see that a lot of
companies well they're running out of
ammunition to keep the illusion that
they are profitable remember they need
sales to stay profitable yes they can do
a buyback of stocks they can close
manufacturing plants they can layoff
people but that will not make them
profitable maybe in that quarter but
long-term if they don't have the sales
coming in they'll have to continually
cut and cut and cut until there's
nothing left we see Cisco right now that
their revenue well it is plunged between
four and six percent now Wall Street
they were expecting a modest 1% drop and
they're looking at their sales their
revenue and they're saying well in the
future we're not seeing any type of
improvement actually we're going to see
a decline of revenue moving forward now
the strange thing is they really didn't
give an explanation of
why they thought this was going to
happen now of course most likely they
were holding back to say that well it's
because of the economy it's not doing
well and corporations that are out there
that are buying our products they're not
really purchasing as much as they used
to and we notice a lot of corporations
they don't like saying that the economy
is not doing well until the very end
where everything really starts to fall
apart now when Trump was taking office
he was promising that jobs would be
coming back to the United States now
this doesn't mean that jobs and
manufacturing that they're coming back
now this is not the economy that will be
able to support this what he was talking
about was later on now everyone thought
wow since he mentioned it all these jobs
are coming back and I know he was
tweeting out there that look this
company promised this this company
promised 10,000 this company promised
15,000 these were just promises they
didn't do anything and what we can see
right now is that car sales well they've
been declining we see that a lot of the
automobile manufacturers well it looks
like things are not going well for them
and they're going back on their promise
they said they can't do it at this time
they cannot bring the amount of workers
that they said into the country they
can't boost manufacturing right
manufacturing right now and we're
starting to see that GM and Ford well
they're making cuts to their US
workforces and right now it's an
impossibility because this economy that
we are in right now it cannot support it
actually auto sales right now they have
fallen for four straight months in a row
inventory is near record highs use car
sales prices are falling and R&D budgets
have become bloated and interest rates
are half a percentage point higher than
they were five months ago and we're
starting to see that they can't make it
and what is happening is a complete
implosion of the automobile
manufacturers we saw this back when -
five
and eight we're starting to see the same
thing once again and those individuals
who are delinquent on their older loans
of those people who are defaulting on
their auto loans those cars are also
coming back a lot of people coming off
of leases the whole thing is a complete
nightmare the housing market is in the
same exact area where the whole thing is
imploding on itself we saw that mortgage
applications they were down but what's
more important about this is that this
is not a one-off thing this continually
happens where mortgage applications
continually decline and they're
declining faster than the little pop ups
here and there which means the American
person the everyday American person
those individuals that are coming out of
college those individuals that are
looking to purchase a house they just
can't do it actually if you look around
on Zillow and you look at all the
different areas you can see a lot of
houses they are for sale right now and
you'll see because their little red dots
all over the place and if you start
looking at them very very closely you'll
start to see that many of the homes
they've been on the market for a long
time I mean I'm talking months now every
area is not the same some areas are
doing a little bit better than others
but what happens is as I've been
tracking all of this it's continually
spreading to more and more areas and
something else that's very interesting
that has to do with the job market I
know a couple of individuals that work
in the New York area and they have firms
that basically help tech individuals get
jobs in other firms either as a
consultant or a full-time job lately
they've been doing a lot of consultant
work because there's not a lot of
full-time jobs out there but what
they've noticed in the last six months
or so and they saying it's gotten worse
in the last month and a half jobs are
drying up and actually they can't even
get individuals out on interviews and
they have all these people just idle and
there's nowhere to put them and what
that means is if they're not out there
working and usually these individuals
get a per hour rate those individuals
that play
they're not getting paid either and I
was talking to them the other day and
they're saying that this is a really big
problem and they're a little nervous
about what's happening in the economy
because when they look at the
unemployment rate they're saying well
we're down to four point four percent I
don't understand why this is a problem
right now now we've been looking at this
for a very long time and we understand
and we know that this whole entire
unemployment number is completely fake
phony and false same thing with the
housing numbers same thing with the
retail numbers what they do is they
manipulate all these numbers to make you
think that the economy is doing well
even though when we look at it and we
strip away all the manipulation we can
see what is really going on and then the
other thing that we see when we go
around and we drive around or we talk to
other people we can see that things are
rapidly falling apart very very quickly
but everyone doesn't like to admit this
actually I remember back in 2008 when
the crisis was hitting and the stock
market was falling people were losing
their jobs even the people in the
neighborhoods no one wanted to admit if
they were working or not working and you
could see more and more individuals
staying home because they were out of
work but no one was outside saying hey I
was laid off were you laid off it wasn't
like that it was very very quiet nobody
wanted to admit anything and I think the
same thing is happening once again where
there's a lot of people who have been
laid off a lot of people looking for
work who changed work getting a lower
salary or taking on a part-time job or
can't find a full-time job and no one is
really talking about it everyone just
staying quiet about it
because a lot of people get embarrassed
by this so what is happening in the
economy right now is that the whole
entire system is breaking apart and it's
accelerating right now we see the Philly
Fed right now well this has basically
smashed all expectations
it's shot up but the strange thing about
it is that employment dropped new orders
dropped prices paid dropped but
shipments surged which is kind of odd
and we can see right now that most
likely the neck
go around we're going to see the Philly
Fed plummet just like all the other
indicators now Trump is getting ready to
push forward the NAFTA renegotiations
he's letting light Houser go ahead with
the renegotiations and this is a 100 day
or 90 day notification to Congress
letting them know that they are about to
do this and we'll have to see how that
all works out now something very
interesting is that Congress they're
looking at 401 k's right now and we can
see right now with surveys that are out
there polls that are out there that 75%
of Americans disapprove of the job our
representatives are doing and the reason
why I wanted to mention this is because
while only about 13% of US employees
nationwide enjoy a retirement fund that
assures a stable lifelong income all 535
members of Congress do now of course
this is courtesy of Uncle Sam members of
Congress they participate in a Federal
Employees Retirement System which
provides pension benefits of which most
American workers can only dream of
private retirement savers often pay
management fees that exceed 1% annually
on a lousy investment choice members of
Congress well they pay a maximum of
point zero three nine percent for funds
guaranteed to match the market and of
course this was explained away in the
beginning because they said well
government workers they don't make that
much and they get you know health
benefits they get retirement because
their salaries are very very low
actually today government employees are
making more than in the private industry
so that whole entire argument doesn't
pan out anymore we also see there's a
proposal out in Washington and what they
want to do they want to end the tax
deductibility of your pension
contributions so they can give a 1.5
billion tax break to US corporations
Congress is reportedly considering
whether reduce the
of contributing to a 401k and similar
retirement plans the new proposal we
treat all 401ks and traditional IRA
contributions as if they were but they
were wroth and IRA contributions you
lose the tax exclusion of those
contributions but your future 401k IRA
earnings and appreciation would be
tax-free something this would this could
raise about 1.5 trillion in additional
tax revenue over the next decade well
unless they decide to tax retirement
earnings and appreciation - but right
now any income and gains your 401k or
traditional IRA generate don't get taxed
until you make withdrawals but in but
this proposal would impose a fifteen
percent tax on those annual gains
raising another 1.5 trillion over the
next decade it's not really a question
of whether retirement plans will get a
haircut
but how much and we can see that of
course Congress well they're safe if you
notice the government always does things
to the people they never touch what they
have and they want you to accept
anything they do and again it's one set
of rules for them and another set of
rules for the people and again you have
to remember the government is looking to
get revenue they don't have enough
revenue coming in to support this debt
to support the interest on the debt to
support everything they're doing this is
why they continually need more and more
taxes and the cycle will never end
now deutsche bank they're being sued for
running an international criminal
organization and there's an italian
court that's bringing them up on charges
and we know that all these banks they're
doing money laundering they're part of
crime they're using it for drug
laundering all these banks are doing the
same exact thing it's not just deutsche
bank it's hsbc and many others and we
can see that more and more governments
they're starting to real
what these banks are actually doing now
something very interesting the market
fell by like 372 points yesterday but
the corporate media started a new
campaign which I find very interesting
where they're out there and this is
almost every major news corporate media
news outlet had it they were blaming the
decline of the stock market on Trump now
the reason why they have started to do
this because they started to brainwash
the public just like they're
brainwashing the public about Russian
collusion and everything else because
what I see happening right now as they
have this new FBI this ex-fbi former FBI
individual Mueller come in and run this
special investigation into the Russian
collusion they're going to come out with
tidbits every so often and the market is
going to go down and they're going to
continually say oh the markets going
down because of Trump he's corrupt and
they're going to continually go on and
on about this and why are they doing
this because they are setting him up to
take the fall for the entire economy
coming down now we've been talking about
this that there's a battle going on
between the central bank and the Trump
administration on who brings the economy
down and who owns the narrative here we
are with the news organizations they're
out there already blaming him for what
has happened and of course this has
something to do with him because we know
the stock market is computer driven they
can bring it up they can bring it down
they could do whatever they want the
central bank can crash it in a second
but what they're doing is they're
creating this narrative because they
want to blame it all on him and you're
going to see going forward now as the
chaos continues and as they keep pushing
their agenda they are going to
continually use this to blame him and
this is why you need to be prepared and
ready because no matter what happens the
economy is coming down and when it comes
down it's going to be a disaster either
way and people are going to be shocked
people are going to be surprised because
they're not going to understand this
just like I talked about the consulting
firm they don't realize what's going on
they know there's a problem
it doesn't match the four point four
percent unemployment rate they know that
there's jobs out there because the
government is telling us there is but
they can't find any jobs to place their
individuals so they know something's
wrong and a lot of people they feel it
they just can't put their finger on it
and when it all comes down they're going
to be completely shocked because they've
been living in a world even though they
feel something's wrong they're been
living in a world where they think that
everything is fine and then everything
isn't fine and all of a sudden their
income disappears their savings
disappears everything completely
disappears and then all of a sudden this
is when the problems come in so you need
to be ready and prepared for what is
happening listen everyone thanks a lot
for listening be well be safe and
especially be prepared thanks a lot
